param.name: pwszName
param.para: Pointer to a null-terminated string containing the name of the property.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

remarks.para: For a media source, deleting a property from the metadata collection does not change the original content.

summary.para: Gets a list of the languages in which metadata is available.

param.name: ppvLanguages
param.para: A pointer to a PROPVARIANT that receives the list of languages. The list is returned as an array of null-terminated wide-character strings. Each string in the array is an RFC 1766-compliant language tag.
The returned PROPVARIANT type is VT_VECTOR | VT_LPWSTR. The list might be empty, if no language tags are present. The caller must free the PROPVARIANT by calling .

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: For more information about language tags, see RFC 1766, "Tags for the Identification of Languages".
To set the current language, call .
The following example shows how to get the list of language tags and enumerate the list.

summary.para: Gets a list of all the metadata property names on this object.

param.name: ppvNames
param.para: Pointer to a PROPVARIANT that receives an array of null-terminated wide-character strings. If no properties are available, the PROPVARIANT type is VT_EMPTY. Otherwise, the PROPVARIANT type is VT_VECTOR | VT_LPWSTR. The caller must free the PROPVARIANT by calling .

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

param.name: ppwszRFC1766
param.para: Receives a pointer to a null-terminated string containing an RFC 1766-compliant language tag. The caller must release the string by calling .

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

description.para: The metadata provider does not support multiple languages.

remarks.para: For more information about language tags, see RFC 1766, "Tags for the Identification of Languages."
The and methods set and get metadata for the current language setting.

summary.para: Gets the value of a metadata property.

param.name: pwszName
param.para: A pointer to a null-terminated string that contains the name of the property. To get the list of property names, call .

param.name: ppvValue
param.para: Pointer to a PROPVARIANT that receives the value of the property. The PROPVARIANT type depends on the property. For multivalued properties, the PROPVARIANT is a VT_VECTOR type. The caller must free the PROPVARIANT by calling .

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

description.para: The requested property was not found.

summary.para: Sets the language for setting and retrieving metadata.

param.name: pwszRFC1766
param.para: Pointer to a null-terminated string containing an RFC 1766-compliant language tag.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: For more information about language tags, see RFC 1766, "Tags for the Identification of Languages".

summary.para: Sets the value of a metadata property.

param.name: pwszName
param.para: Pointer to a null-terminated string containing the name of the property.

param.name: ppvValue
param.para: Pointer to a PROPVARIANT that contains the value of the property. For multivalued properties, use a PROPVARIANT with a VT_VECTOR type.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Manages metadata for an object. Metadata is information that describes a media file, stream, or other content. Metadata consists of individual properties, where each property contains a descriptive name and a value. A property may be associated with a particular language.
To get this interface from a media source, use the interface.
